content.description: Climb the splitter hand crack that has a ledge and a flake to the left that make for good handholds. There are some other hidden holds that make it much easier to climb than it looks.
content.location: The drainage that leads up to the First Switchback cliff takes you almost right to this route; just go a little left. You can also find this route by finding The Mother Ship - this route has two bolts in the first 25ft and is at the high point of the ground in the back corner of the massive corner that is the The First Switchback area.

content.description: Climb the off-fingers crack up into the 3ft-wide chimney with 2 splitter cracks in the back. Climb these cracks to a ledge below the final off-width section to the anchors.
content.protection: Camelots .75 to 5; 2 each will do for most climbers, but a 3rd #4 might make you feel a little more at ease.
content.location: From the base of The Mother Ship (which is the route with the two bolts in the first 25ft of the route at the high point of the ground in the corner of the First Switchback area), go left/west about 25ft downhill to the obvious 3ft-wide chimney with the two splitter cracks in the back.

content.description: Pull the off-fingers overhanging bulge to enter the tight hands to hands crack in the left-facing dihedral. The bolted anchors are under the large roof above.
content.location: First, visualize the First Switchback area a one large dihedral with The Mother Ship (2 bolts within the first 25 feet of the route leading to a crack in the corner) as the very back of the dihedral). This is the highest point of ground at the base of the cliff. From here, to reach No More Tears, go left (west) along the cliff along a ledge system fora bout 40 yards. You will find this obvious splitter crack in a left-facing corner.

content.description: Climb through 2 bolts to get into the crack in the open book, the large open dihedral of First Switchback area.
content.location: As you hike to the base of the cliff, go left/west to the high point of the ground and look for the 2 bolts leading to the crack in the back open corner.

content.description: To get off the ground, climb the right-facing finger crack using your feet on the zig-zagging seam on the right wall. Soon, you will go through a juggy section that feels a little hollow, but climbs well. Then, back to the lay-backing crack up to a ledge with a bolted anchor.
content.location: From the back corner and highest point of ground in the First Switchback area (The Mother Ship is the route in the back corner with 2 bolts in the first 25 feet), go left/west and downhill about 30ft, past Two Buck Chuck. You will find a right-facing finger crack with a zig-zagging lightening bolt-type seam on the wall to the right, which will be used for footholds.

content.description: Climb past a bolt to get into the finger crack that turns to hands higher up.
content.location: Left along the ledge from Four Guitars, Two Buck Chuck, and Mother Ship.

content.description: There is a thin finger crack going up a right facing corner to a V-slot. After, the crack turns to left-facing with big fingers and tight hands.
content.location: Left along the ledge down from the back corner of First Switchback. Pass Two Buck Chuck, Four Guitars, and Dr. Yu.
